text: I heard a physician say that multiple vaccination will be needed because of short  antibody duration, and is distributing  that information. Anyone have a cite otherwise?

elements.text: I heard a physician say that multiple vaccination will be needed because of short  antibody duration, and is distributing  that information. Anyone have a cite otherwise?

text:
Multiple vaccinations is not really that worrying if you live in a first world country with universal healthcare.
Which  I will admit is a privileged position.
But for me need to be revaccinated would be less annoying than getting a haircut.

text: We don't know enough to say that yet

elements.text: We don't know enough to say that yet

text:
We don’t know enough to say what?
That vaccinations are less annoying than haircuts?
I have had many of both, and as you might judge from my hair, i find haircuts way more annoying.

text:
I guess you mean the original premise, of if they will be needed?
yeah we don’t know.

elements.text:
I guess you mean the original premise, of if they will be needed?
yeah we don’t know.

text: Yes exactly. We don’t know enough about the acquired immunity to say that re-vaccination will be needed. On the contrary, some recent research points to the long-term scenario as a vaccination-free one where everyone acquires immunity naturally as children <https://science.sciencemag.org/content/early/2021/01/11/science.abe6522>
